results.title: Resources in its crust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
The major useful organic and mineral substances found in the earth’s crust. Classifies the resources as the metallic minerals, the non-metallic minerals, and the mineral fuels. How some of them are extracted and processed. Steps necessary to conserve irreplaceable resources.
results.description:

results.title: Reseeding for better grass
results.brief_description: A film for farmers, explaining how to turn coarse pasture lands into good grazing by ploughing up and re-seeding the land without either a cereal nurse crop or first putting it through a rotation.

results.title: Researching the topic
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Finding out”.
Demonstrates the principles of student research through the experiences of a secondary student who is required to do a research project on any aspect of “people and work”. As the practicalities of the task are confronted the audience is guided through the key stages of project planning, information collection and processing, formulating conclusions and presentation. Accompanied by 13p Teacher Notes.

results.title: Researching the story
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode overviews the first part of storytelling - finding a story people can relate to. It describes research techniques such as defining what is a story, story telling styles, finding the angle, getting the facts, developing sources, finding the people, preparing the shoot, briefing the crew and meeting deadlines.

results.title: Research methods
results.creator_credit: Robert Aller and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Poor research methods can lead to disastrous consequences as illustrated by the early use of lobotomies without adequate investigation of their effect, and also by Bruno Bettelheim’s belief in the destructive mother as the cause of autism. Correct scientific research methods which involve random selection and the use of control groups is illustrated in the applied research into improving methods of criminal investigation interviewing techniques.
